q: "I certainly lack experience there, and that's an issue," he said. That being said, Page said he was confident that where he lacked in experience, he made up for it in terms of understanding the industry I am in, and what the company does. Eric Schmidt said Thursday that Page is now ready to lead. told BusinessWeek that running a company collaboratively produces better results "because you have more bandwidth and checking and balancing going on." Saying his "heart was in Indiana," Mike Pence said he would continue to meet with the good and strong and opinionated people of this state before deciding his next move. During a question-and-answer session, Mike Pence said his proudest moment as a congressman came when he helped a Muncie mother avoid deportation to her home country of Sierra Leone.

has said he supports legislation proposed by fellow Republicans, Tennessee Senator Bob Corker and Indiana Representative Mike Pence , that would remove the Fed's employment mandate and have it focus solely on keeping prices stable. Ben Bernanke said inflation is expected to persist below the levels that Fed policy makers have judged to be consistent with their dual mandate from congress for stable prices and maximum employment. for an executive who is transitioning out of the CEO role- and may even be unusual for sitting CEOs, said David Wise, senior principal at management consulting firm Hay Group. But given Eric Schmidt 's success, the board clearly wants to retain his guidance for the next four years. "It's a signal to shareholders that he'll continue to steer the boat," Wise said. Eric Schmidt , 55, is being replaced as chief executive by co-founder Larry Page, 37
